snippet: A proposed ordinance has raised long-simmering tensions between drivers and cyclists, but bicycle advocates hope it could be a breakthrough for such laws.
abstract: Cyclists in San Francisco have been agitating for passage of bill that would allow bike riders to yield rather than stop at stop signs; bill is subject of tensions between cyclists, drivers and pedestrians in city where population and bike ridership has increased dramatically; vote is expected in December.

keywords.value: Traffic and Parking Signals and Signs
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A proposed ordinance has raised long-simmering tensions between drivers and cyclists, but bicycle advocates hope it could be a breakthrough for such laws.

headline.print_headline: Cyclists Bridle at Stop Signs; City May Yield
headline.main: San Francisco May Let Bicyclists Yield at Stop Signs
